title: Quiz 2: Principles & Functions of Management
description: Test on core principles (Unity of Command, Authority) and functions like Planning and Organizing.

questions.question: Which principle of management states that an employee should receive orders from only one superior ('one man - one boss')?
questions.explanation: Unity of Command ensures that each individual reports to only one supervisor to avoid confusion and conflicting instructions.
questions.hint: Think about receiving commands from a single source.

questions.question: Place the steps of the Planning Process in the correct logical sequence.
questions.explanation: Planning follows a logical flow: Assess the situation -> Set Goals -> Implement the plan -> Evaluate the results.

questions.question: ___BLANK___ refers to the right to command or act, while ___BLANK___ is the obligation to perform a duty.
questions.explanation: Authority is the power given to direct others; Responsibility is the obligation to perform the assigned task.
questions.hint: One is the 'power', the other is the 'duty'.

questions.question: Match the Strategic Planning term to its definition:

pairs.right: Future-oriented statement identifying the desired future state
Communicates the reason for the organization's existence
Statement of values and beliefs regarding work
Specific ends to be achieved to carry out the mission

questions.explanation: Vision = Future; Mission = Reason for being; Philosophy = Values; Objectives = Specific goals.
questions.hint: Vision looks forward, Mission looks at 'why we are here'.

questions.question: Which of the following describes 'Decentralization' in an organization?

options.text: Power is retained at the highest level of the organization
Decision-making is delegated to the lowest possible managerial level
There is no chain of command
All decisions are made by the Chief Nurse

questions.explanation: Decentralization disperses decision-making authority down the hierarchy, allowing unit managers to make decisions relevant to their areas.
questions.hint: It is the opposite of keeping all power at the center.

questions.question: Which of the following are recognized purposes of an Organizational Structure? (Select all that apply)

options.text: To establish who is accountable for what
To facilitate easy flow of information
To eliminate the need for managers

questions.explanation: Organizational structure clarifies accountability, reporting lines, communication channels, and coordination. It does not eliminate managers.
questions.hint: Structure creates a map of roles and relationships.

questions.question: A 'Job Specification' describes the duties and responsibilities of a job, while a 'Job Description' lists the human qualities required to perform it.
questions.explanation: False. It is the reverse. A Job Description lists duties/responsibilities. A Job Specification lists human qualities/qualifications.
questions.hint: Specification refers to the 'specifics' of the person needed.

questions.question: What is the acronym used in strategic planning to analyze Strengths, Weaknesses, Opportunities, and Threats?
questions.explanation: SWOT analysis is a standard tool for strategic planning to assess internal and external factors.
questions.hint: Four letters representing the four analysis points.

questions.question: Which principle suggests that the interest of one individual or group should not prevail over the interest of the organization?

options.text: Subordination of Individual Interest to General Interest

questions.explanation: Fayol's principle of Subordination of Individual Interest ensures the organization's goals take precedence over personal agendas.
questions.hint: The 'General Interest' refers to the organization.
